title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in the Jocko Valley, Camas Valley, and Mission Valley, Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include "contract" and "irrigation district." The Act of May 10, 1926 established the Flathead Indian Reservation in Montana, defining terms like "project" as the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project. The "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the "Tribe" refers to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes of the Flathead Nation. A contract must be finalized within one year. The Secretary must offer a contract to the irrigation district within one year to operate the project, including trust responsibilities to the Tribe affected by the Irrigation Division. The United States must ensure responsibilities to the Tribe affected by the Irrigation Division, maintain instream flows for fisheries, and continue repayment obligations for project construction costs. The Act requires an irrigation district to make an accelerated payment of $1,000,000 by December 31, 2001, and amends repayment contracts to separate net revenues from the Power Division for operation and maintenance costs of the Irrigation Division. It also allows for contract revocation. The Act requires an irrigation district to make an accelerated payment of $1,000,000 by December 31, 2001, and separates net revenues from the Power Division for operation and maintenance costs of the Irrigation Division. It allows for contract revocation if the irrigation district damages tribal trust assets. Operation of the project as per the Bureau of Indian Affairs plan of operations in effect on October 31, 1997, is presumed to protect tribal trust assets. The Secretary shall negotiate with the irrigation district to enter into a contract within 1 year. Changes in operation must align with new information, policies, judicial decisions, or negotiations without revocation unless the district refuses to comply. The Secretary must negotiate a contract with the irrigation district within 1 year. The contract will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies paid for with project funds to the district, but not real property rights. The contract negotiated with the irrigation district will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies, but not real property rights or water rights. This Act does not affect the negotiation of water rights between the State of Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
